meanings.definition: To remove the reproductive organs from an animal.
meanings.sent1: The veterinarian desexes the cat to prevent it from having kittens.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to desex pets to control the pet population.
meanings.sent3: The cat joked that it was glad to be desexed so it wouldn't have to deal with kittens.
meanings.sent4: Desexing the dog was like taking away its ability to start a family.
meanings.sent5: The surgery to desex the rabbit was quick and painless.

meanings.definition: To render an animal infertile by removing its reproductive organs.
meanings.sent1: The shelter desexes all animals before they are put up for adoption.
meanings.sent2: Many pet owners choose to desex their pets to avoid unwanted litters.
meanings.sent3: The farmer desexed the rooster, so it wouldn't wake him up at dawn.
meanings.sent4: Desexing the horse was like hitting the pause button on its ability to reproduce.
meanings.sent5: The decision to desex the guinea pig was made after careful consideration of its health.
